intro: Boryangraecum, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants native to arid regions of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plants are characterized by their succulent, fleshy stems and leaves adapted to store water. Boryangraecum species typically produce showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. These plants are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are well-suited to harsh, dry environments.
